name: DETAIL - Is there a Safe Work Method Statement for this task?

DETAIL - Review relevent design / task characteristics and identify hold points

DETAIL - Ensure that Design is approved and Drawings are of the latest revision
DETAIL - Setout inlet & outlet points with inverts as required by Contractor to construct to design
5 - Locate existing services by hand digging or hydrovac
DETAIL - Ensure all services conflicting with the line of trench has been exposed by hand digging or hydrovac
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - All conflicts have been located. New services and/or conflicts to be advised to Project Engineer. Asbuilt all services
DETAIL - Inspect trench profile and ensure it is correct to lines and levels to design
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Line and level is correct
DETAIL - Ensure trench width is sufficient to provide enough space on either side of the pipe for compaction
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - 300mm either side of the pipe
DETAIL - Test formation level on completion of excavation to check if undercut required
FREQUENCY - One test per 15m linear metres
INSPECTION - Scala Penetrometer, Visual Inspection by designer
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - If CBR is less than 2.5 or 50kPa undercut may be required. Seek engineer guidance for undercut depth

DETAIL - If water is in the trench backfill with Drainage 40/20 material ensuring Bidium cloth is pinned to the bottom of the trench. 40/20 material to extend to the mid point on the pipe or to the water table (whichever is highest).
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Ensure material is whacked every 150mm lift
DETAIL - Material to meet specifications dependant on material type selected
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Compliance with requirements from Specifications
DETAIL - Geotextile or Geogrid that is used in the undercut is to be documented on FHIMS-CS-4025
DETAIL - Material to meet specifications dependant on material type selected
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Compliance with requirements from Specifications
DETAIL - Bedding - Ensure correct thickness of bedding is placed and compacted
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - 100mm thick bedding for <450mm dia pipe
DETAIL - Ensure bedding material is compacted
DETAIL - Confirm pipes diameter, class & jointing type as shown on the drawings, and that the pipes are correct and in good condition.
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Pipe - Diameter & Class, Wingwalls, Manholes, Cesspits etc.
DETAIL - If any cast insitu component i.e. Headwalls is to be completed on a separate ITP - FHIMS-QA-6006 Insitu Concrete
DETAIL - Pipe Laying -Variation between design invert level to as-laid invert level must be less than 5mm. Variation of grade of one pipe to the next shall be less than 3mm
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Invert level <= 5mm and grade <= 3mm from design levels
DETAIL - Inspect pipes prior to backfilling to ensure they have been installed correctly and the joints are in place. Check for gaps and/or defects and check pipe alignment for straightness
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - No defects/ gaps / pipes are aligned correctly
DETAIL - As-built survey of pipes installed
FREQUENCY - Once line is completed between 2 structures
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Invert level <= 5mm and grade <= 3mm from design levels
DETAIL - Inspection of pipes prior to backfilling to ensure they have been installed correctly and that the joints are sealed. Check for any gaps.
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Compliance with the Specification
DETAIL - The pipes shall be laid with the variation between the specified invert level and invert level laid shall not exceed 5mm
DETAIL - Pipe invert checks shall be carried out at least once per day with a maximum of 20m between checks.
DETAIL - Material to meet specifications dependant on material type selected
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Compliance with requirements from Specifications
DETAIL - Backfill 150mm lifts with (material) and test every 300mm lift to underside of Subgrade. Remainder of backfill to be done with excavated material.
FREQUENCY - 1 test per 20 m length of trench per 300mm lift
DETAIL - Base of structure to be tested. Scala's to be minimum of 3 blows per 100mm
DETAIL - Structures to be installed to the design survey location and level
DETAIL - All joints are to be sealed including rungs and lids
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Pipe joint to structure shall be encased in 200mm (min.) thick 20MPa concrete
DETAIL - Arrange as-built survey of the structure and all invert levels
DETAIL - On completion of backfilling all lines to be inspected
INSPECTION - Internal Visual Inspection with camera (compliant with Confined Spaces working)
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Lines must be straight, free from dirt and obstructions, with no ponding.
DETAIL - For pipes <900mm a CCTV inspection must be completed. Pipes >900mm must be visually inspected
FREQUENCY - At completion of the works

DETAIL - If called for in the specifications then test results for water tightness in the structures and low pressure air testing of the pipelines is to be carried out - test sheets to be filling in where required
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Drainage Structure Water Tightness Test Record & Low Pressure Air Test Record
DETAIL - Ensure all drainage lines comply with design prior to carrying on with next construction process
FREQUENCY - At completion of drainage line

DETAIL - Ensure that Design is approved and Drawings are of the latest revision
DETAIL - Setout and mark all known services along the line of the Sub-soil Drain.
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Consistency with Construction Drawing
DETAIL - Ensure Subsoil Drainage pipe is TNZ F2 Grade and 110mm diameter Nexus Hiway grade slotted high density polyethelene smooth bore corrugated plastic pipe
INSPECTION - Ensure delivery docket matches materials delivered
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - 110mm diameter Nexus Hiway TNZ F/2 Grade pipe
DETAIL - Ensure drainage material surrounding subsoil pipe conforms to TNZ F/2 and meets the grading limits setout in the NTLDM
DETAIL - Ensure Geotextile Filter Fabric is A29 Bidim, Strength Class C & Filtration Class 1 or equvilant approved by Engineer
INSPECTION - Ensure delivery docket matches materials delivered
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Ensure geotextile is approved for use
DETAIL - Inspect trench profile and ensure it allows minimum 100mm bedding, side support and surround.
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Record levels of base of trench on dip sheet
DETAIL - Ensure the trench is cut in a manner than will ensure that the pipes will be laid true to the depths, grades and lines shown on the drawings.
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Ensure trench line and levels match the design drawings
DETAIL - Design Engineer to be informed of unsuitable ground or seepage in Trench and instruct testing and remedial works.
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Design Engineer to instruct action and record on dip sheet and as built drawing
DETAIL - Upon completion of trenching A29 Bidim or similar approved Geotextile to be placed into the trench and pinned to ensure the geotextile 'wraps' the TNZ F/2 material
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Ensure material covers the trench and is pinned in place
DETAIL - Ensure 100mm thick conforming TNZ F/2 bedding is placed in base of trench.
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Record levels of top of bedding on dip sheet
DETAIL - Ensure Subsoil Pipe is laid on the Bedding in the centre of the trench
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Consistency with Subsoil Details
DETAIL - As built Survey the Pipe before backfill
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Consistency with Subsoil Details
DETAIL - Backfill by tipping conforming TNZ F/2 into the trench
DETAIL - Cover over the trench so that chip does not get contaminated by other construction activities - this might be with the pavement material or by cloth if other work is going to take place
DETAIL - Ensure minimum entry point 150mm above soffit of outlet stormwater pipe
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Consistency with Subsoil Details
DETAIL - Perforate Catchpit and epoxy grout pipe from inside to completely seal connection.
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Consistency with Subsoil Details
DETAIL - If a subsoil drain outlets to a swale drain/grassed area ensure that a concrete plinth is construction and a marker post is installed - survey to pick up immediately
DETAIL - Ensure all subsoil drainage lines comply with design prior to carrying on with next construction process
FREQUENCY - At completion of sub soil drainage line
DETAIL - Red pen mark up drawings to be included in QA file

DETAIL - Ensure that Design is approved and Drawings are of the latest revision
DETAIL - Set out base of wall to 1m offset.
○ Setout and mark all known services along the line of the Retaining Wall.
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Consistency with Construction Drawing. Designer to confirm extent of MSE Wall
DETAIL - All baskets are to be ordered in accordance with the specifications & drawings
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Any defective baskets are NOT to be used in the wall construction - return to the supplier immediately
5 - Gabion Rock and Backfill Material Compliance Testing
DETAIL - Material to meet specifications and approved by engineer
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Compliance with requirements and approved by engineer
DETAIL - Carry out compaction trial minimum of 3x superimposed layers to determine peak achievable compaction (NDM)
DETAIL - All geotextile & geogrid are to be ordered in accordance with the specifications & drawings

CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Geotextile: Strength Class C, Filtration Class 1. Uniaxial Geogrid: Tensar RE510. Biaxial Geogrid to have same unltimate tensile strength as uniaxial - 16KN/m, 100 yr design life
DETAIL - Excavate footprint of the wall area to the correct line and level and ensure area safe to work in.
DETAIL - Base of excavation to be checked by Geotech engineer / Design Engineer
DETAIL - Compact subgrade and test the base to ensure it meets 50kPa.
FREQUENCY - Prior to construction of wall
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - 2-3 blows/100mm. If CBR is less than 2.5 or 50kPa undercut may be required. Seek engineer guidance for undercut depth
DETAIL - If subsoil drainage is required for this wall construction then follow the FHIMS-QA-6010 ITP for Subsoil Drainage
FREQUENCY - Prior to construction of wall
DETAIL - Leveling pad to be 300mm compacted aggregate, can include 75mm concrete topping without reinforcing steel
DETAIL - Erect the first level of baskets as per Manufacturers specs along the front face of layers to ensure correct line and level.
DETAIL - Tie the 1st layer of baskets together using Manufacturers specs for tying baskets
DETAIL - Install geotextile filter fabric, strength class C, filtration class 1
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Geotextile: Strength Class C, Filtration Class 1.
DETAIL - Place first 100mm layer of filter material
DETAIL - Install subsoil drainage as per FHIMS-QA-6010 ITP for Subsoil Drainage
FREQUENCY - Prior to construction of wall
DETAIL - Install 1st layer geogrid and attach to gabbion basket
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Uniaxial Geogrid: Tensar RE510. Biaxial Geogrid to have same unltimate tensile strength as uniaxial - 16KN/m, 100 yr design life

DETAIL - Place Gabion material into baskets ensuring the outside facing the flat side of the bigger stones are placed by hand to ensure that the baskets are kept square. Tip Gabion material slowly into the baskets to fill the voids as much as possible
DETAIL - Backfill 1st layer in accordance with the specifications & drawings
FREQUENCY - 2x sets of NDMs for each 1m high by 3m wide by 20m long layer
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - 95% of Standard or 92% Vibrating Hammer
DETAIL - Tie 2nd layer of Gabion to the top of the previous layer to ensure that they wont move when rocks are placed inside & complete the basket filling process again
DETAIL - Install 2nd layer geogrid and attach to gabbion basket.
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Uniaxial Geogrid: Tensar RE510. Biaxial Geogrid to have same unltimate tensile strength as uniaxial - 16KN/m, 100 yr design life

DETAIL - Place Gabion material into baskets ensuring the outside facing the flat side of the bigger stones are placed by hand to ensure that the baskets are kept square. Tip Gabion material slowly into the baskets to fill the voids as much as possible
DETAIL - Backfill 2nd layer in accordance with the specifications & drawings
FREQUENCY - 2x sets of NDMs for each 1m high by 3m wide by 20m long layer
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - 95% of Standard or 92% Vibrating Hammer
DETAIL - Tie 3rd layer of Gabion to the top of the previous layer to ensure that they wont move when rocks are placed inside & complete the basket filling process again
DETAIL - Install 3rd layer geogrid and attach to gabbion basket.
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Uniaxial Geogrid: Tensar RE510. Biaxial Geogrid to have same unltimate tensile strength as uniaxial - 16KN/m, 100 yr design life
DETAIL - Place Gabion material into baskets ensuring the outside facing the flat side of the bigger stones are placed by hand to ensure that the baskets are kept square
DETAIL - Tip Gabion material slowly into the baskets to fill the voids as much as possible
DETAIL - Backfill 3rd layer in accordance with the specifications & drawings
FREQUENCY - 2x sets of NDMs for each 1m high by 3m wide by 20m long layer
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - 95% of Standard or 92% Vibrating Hammer
DETAIL - Ensure all works comply with design prior to carrying on with next construction process
FREQUENCY - At completion of sub soil drainage line and each gabion layer

DETAIL - Check Strand Size and type complies with Specifications
